@cpuhrsch I just found out I was modifying the wrong file for my test. I was originally modifying aten/src/ATen/native/cpu/SoftMaxKernel.cpp I really should have been modifying ./aten/src/ATen/native/SoftMax.cpp when running test_Softmax2d. I changed the partitioner to static tbb::simple_partitioner ap; and the problem does not show even when running on 32+ threads and running it multiple times.

It looks like this isn't a problem in pytorch but rather in tbb when running on ppc64le architecture. I built the unit tests that comes with tbb and when running test_parallel_for, I get an assert failure that leads to an abort. The assert looks like something to do with tasks stealing that tbb implements. I found out in some group discussion how to turn off tasks stealing and it mentioned to use simple_partitioner which is what I did and it seems to be working.

I guess the question for now is can I submit a PR with this change for ppc64le ? If so, do I use an ifdef in the code? I also think other instances that use parallel_for needs to be changed to use simple_partitioner for ppc64le. Please let me know.
